H0.text: Coal is a nonrenewable natural resource found in Maryland, and its use in daily activities often produces waste products.

H1.text: Soil is a nonrenewable natural resource found in Maryland, one of many resources in the state that people use daily and that can be either renewable or nonrenewable, often producing waste products.

H2.text: Water is a nonrenewable natural resource found in Maryland among many renewable and nonrenewable resources, used in daily activities, and its use often produces waste products.

H3.text: Wood is a nonrenewable natural resource found in Maryland, used in daily activities and often producing waste products.
